document.docAuthor: Cardoso, Giovanna Monticelli, Campos-Filho, Ivanklin Soares & Araujo, Paula Beatriz
document.docTitle: Brasiloniscus littoralis Cardoso & Campos-Filho & Araujo 2018, gen. et sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Brasiloniscus (Oniscidea, Pudeoniscidae) with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of Brasiloniscus (Oniscidea, Pudeoniscidae) with description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph: urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act:5C0F5435-A652-4345-AF75-76D746432BFE
Figs 5–6 , 7C

Body with dorsal surface slightly tuberculate, telson triangular with lateral sides concave and distal portion narrow, dactylar seta with fringe of small setae on apex, male pleopod 1 exopod as long as wide with deep re-entrance on distal portion, and male pleopod 1 endopod with distal portion acute bearing a slight lobe on inner margin.
The new specific epithet refers to the Latin adjective ‘littoralis’, used to describe the seashore/coast, in reference to the locality where the specimens were collected.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
BRAZIL : 1 ♂ , state of Rio de Janeiro , Trindade , 23°19′47.71″ S , 44°42′20.59″ W , on tree bark,
6 Dec. 2013
, G.M. Cardoso and I.S. Campos-Filho leg. ( MZUSP 36181 ).
BRAZIL : 1 ♂ , 2 ♀♀ , same data as for holotype ( MZUSP 36182 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: MEASUREMENTS. Maximum body length: ♂ 7 mm .
PLEON ( Fig. 5F–G ). Neopleura 5 shorter than distal margin of uropod protopod; telson with shallow dorsal depression and apex rounded.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 5.
Brasiloniscus littoralis
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♂ (MZUSP 36182). A . Habitus, lateral view. B . Dorsal scale-setae. C . Cephalon and pereonite 1, dorsal view. D . Cephalon, frontal view. E . Pereonites 1–3, ventral view. F . Pleonites 4 and 5, telson and uropods, ventral view. G . Pleonites 4 and 5, telson and uropods, dorsal view. H . Antennula. I . Antenna. J . Antennal flagellum. K . Left mandible. L . Right mandible. M . Maxillula. N . Maxilla. O . Maxilliped. P . Maxilliped endite. Scale bar: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
MOUTH . Buccal pieces ( Fig. 5K–P ) as in
B. maculatus
gen. et comb. nov. , except left mandible with 2+1 penicils, maxillula inner branch with distal tip and maxilliped endite with two hooks on distal margin.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Brasiloniscus littoralis
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♂ (MZUSP 36182). A . Uropod. B . Pereopod 1. C . Pereopod 1 dactylus. D . Pereopod 7. E . Genitalia. F . Pleopod 1. G . Pleopod 1 endopod. H . Pleopod 2. I . Pleopod 3 exopod. J . Pleopod 4 exopod. K . Pleopod 5 exopod.

subSubSection.paragraph: PLEOPOD EXOPODS. Respiratory areas as in diagnosis.
GENITAL PAPILLA. As in Fig. 6E.

The new species resembles
B. maculatus
gen. et comb. nov. in the shape of body and male pleopod 1; it can be easily distinguished in the shape of the telson, pereopod 7 base without lobe on distal sternal margin, and dactylar seta with fringe of thin setae on the distal portion.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7. A .
Brasiloniscus maculatus (Lemos de Castro, 1973)
gen. et comb. nov. , paratype, ♂ (MNRJ 6212). – B .
Brasiloniscus verrucosus (Lemos de Castro, 1973)
gen. et comb. nov. , paratype, ♀ (MNRJ 6214). – C .
Brasiloniscus littoralis
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♂ (MZUSP 36182). Scale bars: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
As mentioned previously, the male of
B. verrucosus
gen. et comb. nov. remains unknown, which makes a comparison with the new species difficult. However,
B. littoralis
gen. et sp. nov. is distinguished from
B. verrucosus
gen. et comb. nov. in the absence of dorsal tuberculation (see also Fig. 7B–C ).
